result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Order Appointing Counsel. Return to Sender. Unclaimed.

Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Bond remains in its present form. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:52 pm.

3:PM Defendant Warren Scott Harer appears by phone,  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appears by phone, Atty Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Peterson would like to waive the PH. Court questions DE. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
